meta.content: Corrections; Washington; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Correction of November 6 Critic's Notebook column on television shows and films that have depicted presidency

block.p: A Critic's Notebook article yesterday about television shows and films that have depicted the presidency misstated a story element from ''Seven Days in May.'' In that 1964 film, a plot to take over the White House is ultimately thwarted; the president is not overthrown.

A caption with the article, about another 1964 movie, ''Dr. Strangelove,'' gave an erroneous identification from Columbia Pictures for the actor shown at the left in the top picture. He was Peter Bull, not George C. Scott. Peter Sellers was correctly identified at the right.

A Critic's Notebook article yesterday about television shows and films that have depicted the presidency misstated a story element from ''Seven Days in May.'' In that 1964 film, a plot to take over the White House is ultimately thwarted; the president is not overthrown.

A caption with the article, about another 1964 movie, ''Dr. Strangelove,'' gave an erroneous identification from Columbia Pictures for the actor shown at the left in the top picture. He was Peter Bull, not George C. Scott. Peter Sellers was correctly identified at the right.
